Karl Heinz Rummenigge's full interview on Sport1 Doppelpass:

... on Lewandowski: "He is very good speaker. I had a lot of conversations with him. He addresses mistakes in the team or at the club. He has become an important personality off the pitch. For example, we won the Champions Leauge in Lisbon. When I went to Robert, he happily said to me: 'We have the best bench, that's why we won. We can now shape an era.'"

... on Alaba's contract situation: "I don't know the rumors. From January 1st, he can initiate talks and sign a contract with a new club. He arrived at Bayern as a young player 12 years ago. It was impossible to come to an agreement. We had a lot of conversations. We wanted an answer by the end of October. That didn't come. I honestly don't know whether another conversation will take place. We made him an offer that was more worthy and valued. But the offer was not accepted. We also suffer from corona."

... on Boateng's future: "I think he's playing a decent to good season, but a player of his age has to be patient. We have decided that at a suitable time in the second half of the season we will sit down and talk about the future."

... on Sané's substitution: "Of course he wasn't happy and satisfied. I spoke to the coach this morning. He explained that well. He said he wanted to sub on Musiala because he wanted to win the game. The coach did everything right. Sané is fast, can dribble and has a great left foot. He still doesn't have the Bayern gene, he hasn't arrived completely yet. He has to work on his talent. The team supports him. He has to take the next step, he has the options. He has to adapt his character to the club. He has to learn that. He has to adapt his character to the team. We are ready to help him. But he also has to help himself. His talent is outstanding."

... on winter transfers: "We haven't had a spectator in the stadium for a long time. You have to take this into account. Nothing is planned in winter and nothing is planned to sell anyone."
